comments.text:
Created attachment 544801
nss cross compilation patch

Cross compilation from one Linux architecture to another (e.g. x86 -> arm) does not appear to be be possible in a simple way. For example, trying to build with this command line fails:

# make CC=arm-linux-gcc

As CC is used to compile some host tools. The attached patch adds a new variable "TARGETCC" which can be set on the command line without breaking host tool compilation. It can be used like:

make NATIVE_CC=gcc TARGETCC=arm-linux-gcc

It's possible I have misunderstood the mechanism for cross compiling libnss but I couldn't find any other way to do it.
